monogr.title: A discourse of the preseruation of the sight: of melancholike diseases; of rheumes, and of old age. Composed by M. Andreas Laurentius, ordinarie phisition to the King, and publike professor of phisicke in the Vniuersitie of Mompelier. Translated out of French into English, according to the last edition, by Richard Surphlet, practitioner in phisicke
monogr.author: Du Laurens, André

div.head: Idem de eadem Idiomate Anglico.
div.l: To whom that Galen of our age did dying leaue
His diuine Phisicke Muse 'mongst other learned works,
This treatise fraught with skill, did write in vulgar tongue
Of th'Eyes, Melancholie, Old-age, and troublous Rheume,
Which Surphlet famous for his art-taught cunning hand,
In cleering th'Eyes of spots, and noysome Catarrhacts,
(Least France the happie nurse and mother of great wits,
Should sole enioy this pearle) hath clad with English weede
A worke of worth for Councellers and men of great estate,
For Ladies, Students, such as 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 loue.
Hence base Quack-saluers, boasting Thrasoes loathsome brood,
Who blindly and boldly rush into that sacred Art,
Which none but Phoebus sonnes and Darlings of Minerue
Could euer rightly exercise: Hence, hence apace,
Pollute not with your filthie fists and pur-blind eyes
These golden Theorems, these skilfull Medicins:
For you poore sots (I wisse) the paines were neuer meant.
